title: Ever been on a losing streak and just get more and more emotionally unsettled looking for a win
body:
https://media.tenor.com/images/f4018afae648d7b9eebb07181c59f56b/raw

The league experience for me right now

Despite 23 kills my last game, the streak continues.

I should take a break

replies.body: I like to mix in ARAM games every now and then. Or you could play other games, you'll eventually return to league if you like it enough.

> [{quoted}](name=Kam913,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=VIrJEFLA,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-12-28T20:59:42.981+0000)
>
> I like to mix in ARAM games every now and then. Or you could play other games, you'll eventually return to league if you like it enough.

That or an easy bot game if you just want to farm your First Win for that day.
I felt the same way so I just abandoned LoL and started playing Nioh. I don't even want to do the wins of the day anymore.
Ooooh I left league for nioh too i think it's a pretty good game :D
Yes, take a break :). Even when your personally playing good but losing and it starts to be a strain a short break can help. Gl

Don;t take a break, quit. This game is just the slotmachine now, youre wasting your time and energy on something that is entirely out of your control. 
https://imgur.com/a/brmeo#OjzlPAd

I recently uninstalled, as should you.

Not saying it applies to you, but sometimes I see players like this: 
They pick top lane or jungle. They don't respond to the team.  Solo most of the time and taking all kills possible but missing 2nd part of the game - carrying the team or doing objectives. In other word - those lone wolves forgets that it's a team game, not tetris. Even if they gets loads of kills they still fails to rally the team and carry them.

the answer is yes if you got on a three loss streak thats the time you should cut your loses and stop playing for the day or go onto a smurf. take this from a person who had a 10 loss streak once before

I hate it when people smurf for this reason. Ruining new players' games, who can not challenge you, just so you can feel good about yourself is pretty lame. It feels bad for the five people on the enemy team who are going to lose and it probably feels bad for the four people on your team who wanted a fair game like normal people.

It feels bad for the five people on the enemy team who are going to lose and it probably feels bad for the four people on your team who wanted a fair game like normal people.

You're likely to be matched with other smurfers when you smurf :v
Yeah, after a time. If that is the case for a smurf account, why would you use it to get over a losing streak?

> [{quoted}](name=Raven Redeemed,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=VIrJEFLA,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2017-12-29T08:11:35.473+0000)
>
> Yeah, after a time. If that is the case for a smurf account, why would you use it to get over a losing streak?

Leveling. One account might be on a win streak, the other a loss streak. Lessens the sting of consecutive losses since, apparently, matchmaking pushes that 50% winrate.

I don't know if it is still this way , but matchmaking wouldn't always update your mmr fast enough and would estimate so you could possibly just get stuck with a group lower than you simply because you lost the last game. 

Also on a losing streak is more likely to be matched with people falling on the ladder as well. 

Not to mention just being tilted effects gameplay.
